intro: Ferulago sylvatica subsp. confusa, commonly known as the narrowleaf cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small and white, often appearing in clusters, and it produces a capsule fruit containing several seeds.
